global_principles: Prioritise economy of language while keeping mathematical precision.
Lead with pedagogical motivation before formal statements.
Use consistent L/B/R and ledger terminology to reinforce cross-domain coherence.
Highlight invariants and morphisms explicitly when transitioning between domains.
Assume familiarity with mainstream QFT, string theory, and AGT; reference rather than re-teach standard constructions.
Keep non-storyline exposition atomic—state the result, cite the source, move on.
Maintain academic honesty: articulate assumptions and limitations when presenting conjectures or heuristics.

tone.description: Write with a clear instructional voice that guides the reader through progressively deeper abstractions without superfluous prose, while respecting a peer audience in high-energy theory.

structural_habits: Open each section with a domain hand-off reminding the reader what is being imported.
Frame definitions and theorems with short narrative bridges explaining purpose and ledger impact.
Keep examples brisk and emblematic; avoid exhaustive case listings unless they surface a new invariant.
Reserve rhetorical emphasis (e.g., italics, footnotes) for signposting cross-domain reuse.
Flag conjectural or heuristic arguments explicitly and provide canonical references.

section_specific_notes.focus: Invite the reader with minimal jargon while foreshadowing ledger terminology.
State formal grammar succinctly, prefacing each block with a one-sentence pedagogical cue.
Maintain theoretical diction even when introducing empirical terminology; emphasise mappings over anecdotes.
Balance conjectural language with precise spectral definitions to retain mathematical elegance.

thread_alignment.style_cue: Use crisp comparative sentences to align the three computation paradigms before presenting equations.
Adopt formal-yet-teaching tone: definition, intuition, immediate consequence.
Signal domain transitions with ledger verbs (import/export) and keep exposition diagrammatic.
Anchor speculative claims with explicit operator identities to preserve reader confidence.
Write in imperative-but-compact sentences so engineers can treat the appendix as a checklist.

audience.notes: Write as peers in high-energy theory; do not re-derive standard results unless they anchor a storyline.
